page.title: 11POST OFFICE
page.content: The{Post Office}in Shirwell is at the village shop which only recently took over this function from a villager whose front room had been converted for the purpose. A plaque still remains in place on the house where the post office used to be. There are two collecting boxes, one being at the local village shop itself and the other further down in Shirwell Town. There are 3 postmen delivering mail to the village in vans (red) from the collecting main office in Barnstaple, each having the Shirwell run for a week.They deliver each morning and if familiar with the house holder will open the door and put the mail on chairs,tables etc and if lucky have a hot drink. There is only 1 public telephone situated in the village near the post office.
